stories.text:
In 2022 I will begin a brand new ritual: Open Mic

I will share a startup on my Twitter every day.

I'm going to ask them an open-ended question.

Let the party begin

Follow on my Twitter: https://twitter.com/sametozkale
stories.title: My New 2022 Ritual: Open Mic
Hacker Hijacks HP AMD EPYC Servers for Raptoreum Crypto Mining

stories.text:
It seems better for commercial usage compared to the GPL since it isn't as strict while also guaranteeing the users of the MPL licensed library will share their changes. I'm curious what HN users think of it as a library license.

To people who might suggest LGPL: it is a no-go if you're using a language that's statically linked (Go / Rust) or a dynamic language.

(Info about MPL: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/FAQ/)

Additional question, do companies have policies that ban MPL?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is MPL a good license for libraries?

The global version of Steam appears to be banned in China
